body:
This output is confusing. Are you saying it works sometimes and sometimes not?

Or are you saying that it used to work but no longer does?

Hi @bagder 

Thank you for replying back.

i have 2 linux ubuntu machines and installed curl on both. 

on one ubuntu machine(curl working ) i have installed curl on 11 November by using steps provided by you.
on this machine curl is working fine

on another ubuntu machine also (curl not working) i have installed curl on 17 November by using same steps but on this machine i am getting error.

i was just wondering is this issue related to ssl routine function or openssl issue

please let me know if you need more info
Does the problem reproduce if you try a public URL we too can access? Like `https://curl.se` for example?

it seems to be showing different error 

root@ubuntu:~# curl -v -k --http3 https://curl.se/

curl: (55) ngtcp2_conn_handle_expiry returned error: ERR_HANDSHAKE_TIMEOUT

I have gotten the same error in wsl2(ubuntu 22.04.1) by doing this

 **curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.2/install.sh | bash**

   % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
  0     0    0     0    0     0      0      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--     0

**curl: (35) error:0A00010B:SSL routines::wrong version number**


but alternatively ihave used 
**wget -qO- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.2/install.sh | bash**

it installed nvm but doesnt showing any node versions to install(when this command is used  **nvm ls-remote** ) . its just showing N/A. but its displaying nvm -version as 0.39.2. i want to install node >=16 version. how to come out of this problem

I can reproduce. Researching.

@dvrajkiran that's not using http3 so its not the same issue
dafdb20a26d0c890e83dea61a104b75408481ebd is the first bad commit, according to my bisect. /cc @icing

Thank you @bagder for investigating

adding temporary solution here who might have urgent requirment (using curl version 7.86.0 is working fine with --http3)

git clone --branch curl-7_86_0 https://github.com/curl/curl.git

cd curl

autoreconf -fi

LDFLAGS="-Wl,-rpath,/var/local/openssl/lib64" ./configure --with-openssl=/var/local/openssl --with-nghttp3=/var/local/nghttp3 --with-ngtcp2=/var/local/ngtcp2

make

make install
A fix PR for master is currently being CI'ed: #9945
Thank you @bagder and @icing for investing and closing issue.
